comment.author: 33094672@N04
comment._content: This photo is very beautiful as well.  It captures the era very nicely.  Her dress is so neat and I love the flowers.  I have never seen a picture of the actual Helen Keller.  She is lovely.

comment.author: 30625132@N03
comment._content: Helen Keller was the first deaf and blind person to graduate from college. She began writing when she was 11 years old! She was an extreme socialist and her political views were very influential.

comment.author: 9847519@N08
comment._content: thank you for sharing this photo.  very nice.

comment.author: 27709864@N07
comment._content: Beautiful face and features, with an exquisite profile.

comment.author: 33210769@N02
comment._content: Helen Keller is one of the most influential woman in history, she is a mark of inspiration and hope for everyone thinking they can't accomplish something. This photo sticks out to me because it shows Helen Keller in a different light, it shows the feminist side to her. A lot of people just see Helen Keller as a deaf and a mute, but this picture shows her in a dress and she is wearing flowers to symbolize a soft, womanly side to her.

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Disability History, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 88799409@N07
comment._content: Could I use this photo for my school Helen Keller report?

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: LNowack: Yes, please feel free to use this photograph in your report. The images from the Bain News Service collection have no restrictions on use. We are happy that it will help your research. You can find other historical images of Helen Keller in the Prints and Photographs Online Catalog (PPOC): www.loc.gov/pictures/ as well as some contemporary images of her childhood home in Alabama and a performance of the play "The Miracle Worker."
